alert.note: Alert for Clermont (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 6:23PM EDT until July 24 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Campbell and Kenton. In Southwest Ohio, Clermont. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly from Alexandria to New Richmond. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Covington, Independence, Erlanger, Alexandria, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Claryville, Amelia, Wilder, Bethel, New Richmond, Batavia, Silver Grove, Felicity, Melbourne, Withamsville, Coldstream, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights and Crestview.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
